cleaned_text: IST IST Many meds that we take today come from plants that our forefathers once stumbled upon — be it the commonly used aspirin or the antimalarial pills. But the quest for good health is not only centuries old but also full of disasters The difference between allopathic medicine and traditional herbal medicine is not as nebulous as it's believed. There are quite a few herbs out there that have medicinal value and are used in allopathic medicines. Take for instance, the Cinchona. The tropical plant is named after the countess of Chinchon, the wife of a Spanish viceroy who recovered from a violent fever after consuming it with water. Take for instance, the Cinchona.
